text: Valentín Gómez Farías (Spanish pronunciation:[balenˈtiŋ ˈɡomes faˈɾias]; 14 February 1781 – 5 July 1858) was a Mexican physician and liberal politician who became president of Mexico twice, first in 1833, during the period of the First Mexican Republic, and again in 1846, during the Mexican–American War. Category:1781 births Category:1858 deaths Category:Presidents of Mexico Category:Mexican physicians Category:People from Guadalajara
title: Valentín Gómez Farías
